snippet: The Athletics, who have not finished above .500 since 2006, started play Tuesday with the best record in the majors since the All-Star break, and held one of the two wild-card spots in the American League.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column highlights the Oakland Athletics, who have not finished above .500 since 2006 but this season have the best record in the majors since the All-Star break and hold one of the two wild-card spots in the American League.
lead_paragraph: The Athletics, who have not finished above .500 since 2006, started play Tuesday with the best record in the majors since the All-Star break, and held one of the two wild-card spots in the American League.

headline.print_headline: Hitting Home Runs and Beating the Odds
headline.seo: Athletics Are Hitting Home Runs and Beating the Odds
headline.main: A’s Are Hitting Home Runs and Beating the Odds
